title: $1.2bn vow that could see Spurs sell star
text:
Paper Talk: Coleman’s successful surgery, Rose to City and Shaw to Spurs, Auba’s crazy new haircut Staff writers, FOX SPORTS March 27, 2017 2:11pm 
THE verdict on Seamus Coleman’s surgery, the massive offer that could lure Tottenham to sell a star player, and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang’s glow-in-the-dark hair. 
It’s all in Paper Talk! 
COLEMAN’S SURGERY GOES SUCCESFULLY 
Ireland football coach Martin O’Neill says Seamus Coleman’s surgery on his broken leg went successfully, but doctors cannot give a fixed time for when he will return to action. 
The 28-year-old fullback and Ireland skipper suffered the injury in a horror tackle by Neil Taylor, who was sent off in their 2018 World Cup qualifier with Wales. 
O’Neill, whose side’s 0-0 draw maintained their unbeaten record in the qualifiers sitting second in the table behind Serbia, told the BBC his recovery would depend on several factors. 
“I’m not sure, I would only be guessing. Even the doctors and surgeons wouldn’t be terribly sure,” said O’Neill of the timeline for his recovery to full fitness. media_camera Ireland's Seamus Coleman is taken off the pitch. 
“It will take some time, but Seamus has great determination and sometimes those things work very much in your favour, in terms of recovery. 
“I know the doctors and surgeons are all very, very pleased with the way the operation has gone and now it’s time for recuperation. 
He added: “It’s a devastating blow for the lad. He was having a phenomenal season at his club and a phenomenal season for us as captain.” 
Teammate Shane Long revealed he used tips from his wife’s pregnancy to help Coleman after the incident. 
Long’s wife Kayleah told The Sun : “I had a hypnotherapy birth and they taught Shane to help me to breathe through it. media_camera Seamus Coleman (L). 
“He told me: ‘It all came back to me. I was just talking to Seamus, teaching him how to breathe through it.’ He remembered it all. 
“I asked if Seamus was listening to him and he said, ‘Yes, to be fair, he was. He was really breathing well.” 
ROSE TO CITY, SHAW TO SPURS: REPORT 
Pep Guardiola is confident of signing Tottenham’s Danny Rose for £50 million ($82m) this summer, which could see Luke Shaw move to Spurs as his replacement, according to The Mirror. 
The Manchester City manager has reportedly been eyeing the full-back as he rebuilds his squad, with Gael Clichy, Bacary Sagna and skipper Vincent Kompany all set to leave. 
As Spurs are building a new £750m ($1.2bn) stadium, they are reportedly not in a position to turn down such a large offer for Rose. media_camera Tottenham Hotspur's English defender Danny Rose (L) vies with Manchester City's English midfielder Raheem Sterling. 
If Rose leaves the club, then Tottenham would reportedly target Manchester United’s fullback Shaw in a transfer, which would help to save £20-30m overall. 
Shaw has started few matches under Jose Mourinho this season, with mainly cup outings to his name. 
At 21 years old and wanting to play regular football, Spurs may be able to lure him to White Hart Lane. media_camera England's defender Luke Shaw (2R) takes part in a training session. 
AUBA’S GLOW-IN-THE-DARK HAIRCUT 
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang just became even cooler. 
Not only is he one of the world’s best football players, but he has a new haircut that glows in the dark. 
Paul Pogba has been the king of hair styles until now, so will he see this as a challenge? Time will tell. A post shared by Aubameyang (@aubameyang97) on Mar 26, 2017 at 9:50am PDT 
INJURED COSTA A SPAIN DOUBT FOR FRANCE MATCH 
Spain and Chelsea striker Diego Costa suffered an ankle injury in training on Sunday which could rule him out of Tuesday’s friendly international against France, his country’s football federation said. 
“He stays with the squad but his participation in the game on Tuesday in Paris is uncertain,” said Spanish officials in a statement. 
Costa scored one of the goals in Spain’s 4-1 win over Israel in a World Cup qualifier in Gijon on Friday. Spain bully Israel 0:41
